summary:
This mod makes the vanilla human hairstyles available for Dremora. Each in a two-horns and four-horns style. Additional files add scars and eye colors too.
Two easy tutorials allow you to further expand the appearance of the inhabitants of Oblivion.
descriptionHtml:
I used to play as a Dremora in Morrowind and Oblivion so I was really excited when I found the first playable Dremora mod here on the Nexus. But I was soon dissapointed when I found out that costomization of a dremora character was somewhat limited. 
These files aim to give more styling options to the Dremora race. You can use hairs or scars or both. Please remember, none of my files makes the Dremora Race playable. You have to use another mod of your choice for that.
I recommend [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=5942]Playable Dremora Race by MazdaRX8[/url] which I use myself.
Another option might be [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=8358]Fully Playable DremoraRace by LPabon[/url] which looks very intriguing (becoming a dremora vampire?) but I haven\'t tested it myself.


[img]http://img7.imagebanana.com/img/sz3fg8fk/hair.png[/img]

***What it does***
All human (nord) hairstyles can now be used by the Dremora race. Each hairstyle comes in two varieties: two horns and four horns. Additionally I\'ve set up the two vanilla hairstyles the dremora got to display the horns properly.

***Requirements***
Technically none, but you want a mod that enables the Dremora as a playable race. I highly recommend \"Playable Dremora race v1 - Armors clothes and race attribute by MazdaRX8\". You can find it on the Nexus.

***Installation***
Drop Gri_DremoraHair.esp into your ...\\Skyrim\\Data folder.
In the Skyrim Launcher hit Data Files and tick the esp.

***Compatibility***
Any mods that replace part or all of the vanilla human hair (textures and meshes both) will do the same to the dremora hairs. The horns will (should) stay however.
So if you use a mod that replaces the human hairstyles with those the orcs use, dremora characters will get orc hairstyles aswell.
If you use a texture replacer like finer hair or believable hair, it will apply to the dremora hair aswell.

***What it can\'t do***
Well, not incompatible, but any mods that add new hair (as opposed to replacing) won\'t magically add the hair to the dremora race. The dremora race will not profit from extended color sliders. But you can run this mod alongside non-replacing hair mods and extendend color sliders, if you are using them with another character, for example. 

***ChangeLog***
*31.01.2012 v1.0 initial release
has FormIDs starting in 00. May cause saves to fail loading or objects to become invisible.
*02.02.2012 v1.0
rewrote readme, resampled screenshots, still wrong FormIDs
*07.02.2012 v1.5
corrected FormIDs to start with 01

***Credits***
Bethesda for a new world to mod
MazdaRX8 for adding my favourite non-vanilla race to skyrim
ruchard19840706 for \"Coolsims hair non-default esp\" which helped me do this
TheFigment for TesVSnip


[img]http://img7.imagebanana.com/img/ic6pg0g6/scars.png[/img]

***What this mod does***
It adds the vanilla scars to the dremora race. Sadly, the scars are not that visible on the black skin, hope you can see them in the pictures.

***What it not does***
Making the Dremora race playable. I highly recommend \"Playable Dremora race v1 - Armors clothes and race attribute by MazdaRX8\". You can find it on the Nexus.

***Installation***
Drop Gri_DremoraScars.esp into your ...\\Skyrim\\Data folder.
In the Skyrim Launcher hit Data Files and tick the esp.

***ChangeLog***
*06.02.2012 v1.1 initial release
has FormIDs starting in 00. May cause saves to fail loading or objects to become invisible.
*07.02.2012 v1.5
corrected FormIDs to start with 01

***Credits***
Bethesda for a new world to mod
MazdaRX8 for adding my favourite non-vanilla race to skyrim
TheFigment for TesVSnip 


[img]http://img7.imagebanana.com/img/za9g5p4j/eyes.png[/img]

***What it does***
This mod gives new eye colors to the Dremora race. Currently there\'s only orange, red and grey for both male and female. (Of course you can still use the default black eyes) The details in the textures are a bit hard to notice, take a good look ;)

***Requirements***
Any mod that makes the Dremora race playable. Personally I use Playable Dremora Race by MazdaRX8 from Skyrim Nexus.

***Installation***
The files go here
...\\skyrim\\data\\Gri_DremoraEyes.esp
...\\textures\\actors\\character\\eyes\\...
in the skyrim launcher hit data files and tick the esp

***ChangeLog***
12.02.2012 v1.6 initial release

***Credits***
Bethesda for a new world to mod with the Creation Kit :)
MazdaRX8 for adding my favourite non-vanilla race to skyrim
TheFigment for TesVSnip
author: Grimoa
